awd_titl_txt: Workshop to promote Collaborative Paleobotanical Research   between U.S and Chinese Scientists, Santa Barbara, CA,      July 1996
awd_abstract_narration: 9515389  Manchester    This award supports a joint US-China workshop on  paleobotanical research.  The workshop will be held in July  1996 in conjunction with the International Organization of  Paleobotany Conference.  An important objective of the  international conference is to encourage scientific and  professional interaction among paleobotanists from different  parts of the world studying a range of geologic times and  systematic groups. The US-China workshop will expand on the  conference objectives by providing a dedicated forum for  initiation of collaborative research between US and Chinese  scientists.  Workshop organizers have been careful to  structure the program to provide improved opportunities for  the participation of junior scientists from both countries.    Collaboration between the US and China will allow US  researchers  to probe striking similarities between the  fossil floras of Europe and North America, and those of  China. By combining efforts with Chinese paleobotanists, US  paleobotanists will be able to gain a better understanding  of the systematic affinities, stratigraphic ranges, and  biogeographic distribution of extinct plants.  ***
org_div_long_name: Office of International Science and Engineering
